title: Update regarding Quantum Compute
story_body:
NEXUS SOFTWARE CORPORATION INITIATES FULL RECALL OF CLOUDSTREAM ENTERPRISE PLATFORM

NEW YORK, January 15, 2025, 14:32 EST - Nexus Software Corporation (NASDAQ: NXS) announced a mandatory recall of its CloudStream Enterprise Platform, effective immediately, following the identification of critical security vulnerabilities in the product's core architecture.

The recall, disclosed in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission at 13:47 EST, affects all versions of CloudStream Enterprise Platform released between March 2023 and January 2025. Nexus Software Corporation reported that approximately 2,847 enterprise clients across North America and Europe are impacted by the action.

According to the filing, independent security researchers identified multiple zero-day exploits within the CloudStream authentication framework on January 12, 2025. Nexus Software Corporation's internal audit, completed January 14, 2025, confirmed the vulnerabilities could permit unauthorized access to client data systems.

Nexus Software Corporation has suspended all sales of CloudStream Enterprise Platform and initiated client migration to temporary alternative solutions. The company estimates the recall will result in revenue reduction of $127 million to $156 million for fiscal year 2025, with additional remediation costs projected between $43 million and $67 million.

The recall represents a significant operational disruption for Nexus Software Corporation, which derived approximately 34 percent of total revenue from CloudStream Enterprise Platform in fiscal year 2024.

Industry analysts have identified Quantum Compute Corporation (NASDAQ: QNTM) as the primary beneficiary of the Nexus Software Corporation recall. Quantum Compute Corporation's directly competing DataCore Enterprise Suite maintains comparable functionality without the identified security deficiencies.

Quantum Compute Corporation shares increased 7.3 percent to $84.21 in afternoon trading following the Nexus Software Corporation announcement. Nexus Software Corporation shares declined 18.6 percent to $31.47 during the same period.

Quantum Compute Corporation issued a statement at 15:18 EST confirming it has received inquiries from 412 organizations regarding DataCore Enterprise Suite migration since the Nexus Software Corporation recall announcement. The company has deployed additional sales personnel to process the elevated demand volume.

Market research firm Gartner Technology Research estimates the enterprise cloud management software sector represents $8.3 billion in annual revenue. Nexus Software Corporation held approximately 11 percent market share prior to the recall, while Quantum Compute Corporation maintained 9 percent market share.

Nexus Software Corporation has scheduled a conference call for January 17, 2025, at 09:00 EST to address the recall timeline and financial impact.
